intro: Rubus × impeditus, commonly known as the blackberry bramble, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces aggregate fruits, commonly referred to as blackberries, which are rich in antioxidants and flavor. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Due to its aggressive growth, it can become a weed in agricultural and natural settings.
